alert.note: Alert for Conecuh; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 10:38PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following counties, Conecuh and Monroe. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1033 PM CDT, Doppler radar continued to indicate rain showers persisting over the advisory area. Although the overall intensity of the rain has been gradually decreasing, radar estimates that between 2 and 4 inches of rain has fallen across portions of northern Conecuh and northeastern Monroe counties this evening. Excessive runoff from the heavy rain will continue to result in ponding of water on roads, as well as some flooding along roadways, creeks, streams, and low lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fairnelson, Fowler, Bowles, Skinnerton, Cooks Crossroads, Bookers Mill, Lyeffion, China, Ramah, Pine Orchard, Commerce, Deans, Loree, Burnt Corn, Mixonville, Nichburg, Old Texas, Wilcox and Bermuda.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
